articles.title: Who am I?
articles.description: \> Here you can read more about me and have a look at (some of) the stuff that I do
articles.contents:
â€œFundamentally learning about the world through data is really, really coolâ€ â€“  Hadley Wickham

articles.title: Consulting
articles.description: \> I welcome consulting requests from private and public organizations, political parties, NGO's, and other organizations.
articles.contents:
Services include:
Data visualization
Multivariate regression analysis
Causal inference
Geo-spatial data analysis and visualization
Data wrangling










Want to make a request or hear more about how I can help? Donâ€™t hesitate to get in touch!

articles.title: Projects
articles.contents:
R Markdown
This is where I will list my cool projects!

articles.title: R packages
articles.description: \> I love to play around in and to create tools that make some tasks a little simpler. Below are some of the packages that I have recently published/am currently working on
articles.contents:
dyadicdist







Released (version 0.3.1) â€‚ 
The purpose of dyadicdist is to provide quick and easy calculation of dyadic distances between geo-referenced points
The main contribution of dyadicdist is that the output is stored as a long, dyadic tibble as opposed to a wide matrix
Accepts single and dual data inputs




 View on GitHub



ricardo







In progress â€‚ 
ricardo provides access to data on historical football matches from Football-Data.co-uk



 View on GitHub



voters







Released (version 0.1.0) â€‚ 
Use voters to get (spatial) data on Danish polling stations from Danmarks Adressers Web API (DAWA)
The provided id variable allows you to link the individual polling stations to election data from the Danish Election Database




 View on GitHub



claudius





In progress â€‚ 
claudius is inspired by the tigris package and serves as centralized source of spatial data on Danish political, administrative, and geographic units
claudius returns simple features objects

 View on GitHub



racketeer





In progress â€‚ 
racketeer provides easy access to tennis stats such as ATP/WTA rankings and matches







 View on GitHub
